Instruction: In a large bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. In another bowl, whisk together the sugar, melted butter, eggs, and milk until well mixed.
Spread the sweet potato and bacon evenly on the lined baking sheet.

Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes; turn sweet potato and bacon over. Continue baking until the sweet potato becomes tender and the bacon is crispy, about another 20 minutes. Allow the bacon to cool on paper towels.
Add garlic and cook for an additional minute, stirring frequently.
In a separate large bowl, whisk together eggs, buttermilk, and melted butter. Pour the egg mixture into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined; do not overmix.
In a large bowl, combine flour, baking powder, baking soda, curry powder, and salt. Stir in the Cheddar cheese until it is evenly coated.

Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 15 to 20 minutes. Let muffins cool in the pan for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.
Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease a baking sheet.
